name: Barbell Bench Press
description: Classic compound chest exercise performed lying on a flat bench, pressing a barbell from chest level to full arm extension.
instructions: Lie flat on a bench with your feet on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width. Unrack the bar and lower it to your mid-chest with elbows at about 45 degrees. Press the bar back up to full lockout, keeping your shoulder blades retracted throughout.

name: Incline Barbell Bench Press
description: Upper chest focused pressing movement performed on an incline bench set to 30-45 degrees.
instructions: Set the bench to a 30-45 degree incline. Lie back with feet flat on the floor. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it. Lower the bar to your upper chest, then press it back up to full extension. Keep your back pressed against the bench throughout.

name: Decline Barbell Bench Press
description: Lower chest focused pressing movement performed on a decline bench.
instructions: Lie on a decline bench with your feet secured under the leg pads. Grip the barbell slightly wider than shoulder-width and unrack it. Lower the bar to your lower chest, then press it back up to full arm extension. Have a spotter assist you for safety.

name: Dumbbell Bench Press
description: Chest pressing movement using dumbbells, allowing greater range of motion than barbell variation.
instructions: Sit on a flat bench with a dumbbell in each hand resting on your thighs. Lie back, bringing the dumbbells to chest level. Press both dumbbells up until your arms are extended. Lower them back down with control, allowing a deeper stretch at the bottom.

name: Incline Dumbbell Press
description: Upper chest focused pressing movement using dumbbells on an incline bench.
instructions: Set a bench to a 30-45 degree incline. Sit back with a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder level. Press the dumbbells upward until your arms are fully extended. Lower them back slowly to the starting position, feeling the stretch in the upper chest.

name: Dumbbell Flyes
description: Isolation exercise for the chest performed with dumbbells in a wide arc motion.
instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended above your chest, palms facing each other. With a slight bend in your elbows, lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your chest. Squeeze your chest to bring the dumbbells back together above you.

name: Push-ups
description: Fundamental bodyweight chest exercise that also works triceps and shoulders.
instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands slightly wider than shoulder-width, body forming a straight line from head to heels. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your chest nearly touches the floor. Push back up to the starting position by extending your arms fully.

name: Cable Flyes
description: Chest isolation exercise using cables for constant tension throughout the range of motion.
instructions: Set both cable pulleys to shoulder height. Stand in the center and grab a handle in each hand. Step forward slightly and lean your torso forward. With a slight bend in your elbows, bring your hands together in front of your chest in a hugging motion. Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Chest Dips
description: Bodyweight compound exercise emphasizing the lower chest by leaning forward during the dip movement.
instructions: Grip the parallel bars and lift yourself up with arms extended. Lean your torso forward about 30 degrees and flare your elbows slightly outward. Lower yourself until your upper arms are parallel to the floor or you feel a good stretch in the chest. Press back up to the starting position.

name: Machine Chest Press
description: Machine-based pressing movement that provides a guided path for chest development.
instructions: Adjust the seat height so the handles are at chest level. Sit with your back flat against the pad and grip the handles. Press the handles forward until your arms are fully extended. Slowly return to the starting position with control.

name: Pec Deck
description: Machine-based chest isolation exercise that mimics the fly movement with guided arms.
instructions: Sit on the pec deck machine with your back flat against the pad. Place your forearms on the padded arms with elbows at about 90 degrees. Squeeze your chest to bring the pads together in front of you. Slowly open your arms back to the starting position, feeling the stretch.

name: Landmine Press
description: Unique pressing movement using a barbell anchored at one end, targeting upper chest and shoulders.
instructions: Place one end of a barbell in a landmine attachment or corner. Stand facing the barbell and grip the free end with both hands at chest height. Press the barbell up and away from you until your arms are extended. Lower it back to chest height with control. You can also perform this single-arm.

name: Svend Press
description: Unique chest squeezing exercise performed by pressing weight plates together in front of the chest.
instructions: Stand upright holding one or two weight plates pressed together between your palms at chest height. Squeeze the plates together as hard as you can while pressing them straight out in front of you until arms are extended. Bring the plates back to your chest while maintaining the squeeze.

name: Barbell Deadlift
description: Fundamental compound exercise that works the entire posterior chain, performed by lifting a barbell from the floor.
instructions: Stand with feet hip-width apart, barbell over mid-foot. Bend at the hips and knees to grip the bar just outside your legs. Keep your back flat, chest up, and brace your core. Drive through your heels and extend your hips and knees simultaneously to stand up. Lower the bar back to the floor with a controlled hip hinge.

name: Barbell Row
description: Compound horizontal pulling exercise targeting the mid-back muscles.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, hinge at the hips until your torso is roughly 45 degrees to the floor, and grip the barbell with an overhand grip. Pull the barbell toward your lower chest, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top. Lower the bar back down with control.

name: Dumbbell Row
description: Unilateral back exercise that allows for a greater range of motion and helps correct imbalances.
instructions: Place one knee and hand on a flat bench for support, with your other foot on the floor. Hold a dumbbell in the free hand with arm extended. Pull the dumbbell up toward your hip, keeping your elbow close to your body. Squeeze your back at the top, then lower the dumbbell with control. Complete all reps then switch sides.

name: Pull-ups
description: Fundamental bodyweight vertical pulling exercise performed with an overhand grip.
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip slightly wider than shoulder-width. Engage your lats and pull your body up until your chin clears the bar. Lower yourself back down with control to a full dead hang. Avoid swinging or using momentum.

name: Chin-ups
description: Bodyweight vertical pulling exercise with an underhand grip that places more emphasis on the biceps.
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an underhand (supinated) grip at shoulder-width. Pull your body up by driving your elbows down until your chin clears the bar. Lower yourself back to a full dead hang with control. Keep your core engaged throughout.

name: Lat Pulldown
description: Machine-based vertical pulling exercise that serves as an excellent alternative to pull-ups.
instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown machine and adjust the knee pad to secure your legs. Grip the bar wider than shoulder-width with an overhand grip. Pull the bar down to your upper chest while squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly return the bar to the top with arms fully extended.

name: Cable Row
description: Seated horizontal pulling exercise using a cable machine for constant tension on the back.
instructions: Sit at the cable row machine with your feet on the footplate and knees slightly bent. Grip the handle and sit upright with arms extended. Pull the handle toward your midsection, squeezing your shoulder blades together. Slowly extend your arms back to the starting position.

name: T-Bar Row
description: Heavy compound rowing exercise using a T-bar or landmine setup that allows you to load significant weight.
instructions: Straddle the T-bar or a barbell anchored in a landmine. Bend at the hips with a flat back and grip the handles or a V-grip attachment. Pull the weight up toward your chest, driving your elbows back and squeezing your shoulder blades. Lower the weight with control.

name: Pendlay Row
description: Strict barbell row variation where the bar returns to the floor between each rep, eliminating momentum.
instructions: Set up like a deadlift with feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell with an overhand grip. With your torso parallel to the floor, explosively row the bar to your lower chest. Lower the bar back to the floor completely between each rep. Maintain a flat back throughout.

name: Meadows Row
description: Single-arm landmine row variation that provides a unique angle of pull for the lats.
instructions: Stand perpendicular to a landmine barbell with the end of the bar to one side. Stagger your stance with the inside foot forward. Grip the end of the barbell with an overhand grip using the outside hand. Row the bar up toward your hip, driving the elbow back. Lower with control and repeat.

name: Seal Row
description: Chest-supported row variation that eliminates lower back involvement and momentum for strict back isolation.
instructions: Lie face down on a raised flat bench so your arms hang freely below. Grip a barbell or dumbbells with arms fully extended. Row the weight up toward the bench, squeezing your shoulder blades together at the top. Lower with control. The bench support eliminates lower back stress.

name: Rack Pull
description: Partial range of motion deadlift performed from an elevated position in a power rack, emphasizing the upper back and lockout.
instructions: Set the safety pins in a power rack at knee height or slightly below. Load the barbell on the pins and stand with feet hip-width apart. Grip the bar, brace your core, and lift by extending your hips and knees. Lock out at the top and squeeze your back. Lower the bar back to the pins.

name: Good Morning
description: Hip hinge exercise with a barbell on the back that strengthens the posterior chain.
instructions: Place a barbell across your upper back as you would for a squat. Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and a slight bend in your knees. Hinge at the hips, pushing your butt back while lowering your torso until it is nearly parallel to the floor. Drive your hips forward to return to standing.

name: Hyperextension
description: Lower back exercise performed on a hyperextension bench to strengthen the erector spinae.
instructions: Position yourself face down on a hyperextension bench with your hips at the top of the pad and feet secured. Cross your arms over your chest or behind your head. Lower your upper body toward the floor by bending at the waist. Raise your torso back up until your body forms a straight line.

name: Face Pull
description: Cable exercise targeting the rear deltoids and upper back muscles, excellent for shoulder health.
instructions: Set a cable pulley to upper chest height with a rope attachment. Grip the rope with both hands, palms facing each other. Pull the rope toward your face, separating your hands as you pull so they end up beside your ears. Squeeze your rear delts and upper back, then slowly return.

name: Straight Arm Pulldown
description: Cable isolation exercise for the lats performed with arms kept straight throughout the movement.
instructions: Stand facing a high cable pulley with a straight bar or rope attachment. Grip the bar with arms extended in front at shoulder height. Keeping your arms straight with a slight elbow bend, pull the bar down in an arc until it reaches your thighs. Slowly return to the starting position.

name: Single Arm Lat Pulldown
description: Unilateral lat pulldown variation for addressing muscle imbalances and improving mind-muscle connection.
instructions: Sit at a lat pulldown machine and grip a single handle attachment with one hand. With your arm fully extended overhead, pull the handle down toward your shoulder, driving your elbow down and back. Squeeze your lat at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position. Complete all reps then switch sides.

name: Overhead Press
description: Fundamental compound shoulder exercise pressing a barbell overhead from shoulder height.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart and grip the barbell at shoulder width, resting it on your front deltoids. Brace your core and press the bar overhead, moving your head slightly back to clear the bar path. Lock out at the top with the bar directly over your mid-foot. Lower the bar back to your shoulders.

name: Dumbbell Shoulder Press
description: Overhead pressing movement using dumbbells that allows independent arm movement.
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, holding a dumbbell in each hand at shoulder height with palms facing forward. Press both dumbbells overhead until your arms are fully extended. Lower the dumbbells back to shoulder height with control.

name: Lateral Raises
description: Isolation exercise for the lateral head of the deltoid, performed by raising dumbbells out to the sides.
instructions: Stand with a dumbbell in each hand at your sides, palms facing in. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise both arms out to the sides until they reach shoulder height. Pause briefly, then lower the weights back down with control. Avoid using momentum or swinging.

name: Front Raises
description: Isolation exercise for the anterior deltoid, performed by raising dumbbells in front of the body.
instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand in front of your thighs with palms facing your body. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise one or both dumbbells in front of you to shoulder height. Lower them back down with control. Avoid swinging the weights.

name: Rear Delt Flyes
description: Isolation exercise targeting the posterior deltoid, performed bent over with dumbbells.
instructions: Bend at the hips until your torso is nearly parallel to the floor, holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms hanging straight down. With a slight bend in your elbows, raise both dumbbells out to the sides until your arms are parallel to the floor. Squeeze your rear delts at the top, then lower with control.

name: Arnold Press
description: Dumbbell pressing variation that rotates through the full range of deltoid motion, named after Arnold Schwarzenegger.
instructions: Sit on a bench with back support, holding dumbbells at shoulder height with palms facing you (like the top of a curl). As you press the dumbbells overhead, rotate your wrists so that your palms face forward at the top. Reverse the rotation as you lower the dumbbells back to the starting position.

name: Cable Lateral Raise
description: Lateral raise variation using a cable for constant tension throughout the range of motion.
instructions: Stand sideways to a low cable pulley and grip the handle with the far hand. With a slight bend in your elbow, raise your arm out to the side until it reaches shoulder height. Slowly lower back down, maintaining tension in the cable throughout. Complete all reps then switch sides.

name: Upright Row
description: Barbell or dumbbell pulling exercise that targets the lateral deltoids and trapezius.
instructions: Stand holding a barbell with an overhand grip, hands about shoulder-width apart. Pull the barbell straight up along your body, leading with your elbows, until the bar reaches upper chest level. Keep the bar close to your body throughout. Lower the bar back down with control.

name: Barbell Shrug
description: Isolation exercise for the upper trapezius using a barbell to add heavy resistance.
instructions: Stand holding a barbell in front of your thighs with an overhand grip at shoulder width. Keeping your arms straight, shrug your shoulders up toward your ears as high as possible. Hold the contraction briefly at the top, then lower the bar back to the starting position.

name: Dumbbell Shrug
description: Trapezius isolation exercise using dumbbells held at the sides for a natural movement path.
instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand at your sides with palms facing your body. Shrug your shoulders straight up toward your ears, squeezing the traps at the top. Hold briefly, then lower the dumbbells back to the starting position with control.

name: Bradford Press
description: Unique shoulder pressing exercise alternating between front and behind-the-neck pressing without lockout.
instructions: Sit or stand holding a barbell at the front of your shoulders. Press the bar just high enough to clear your head, then lower it behind your neck. Press it back up just over your head and return to the front starting position. Repeat this back-and-forth motion without fully locking out at the top.

name: Z-Press
description: Seated overhead press performed on the floor with legs extended, eliminating leg drive and demanding core stability.
instructions: Sit on the floor with your legs extended straight in front of you inside a power rack. Unrack a barbell at shoulder height and press it overhead to full lockout. Because there is no back support, your core must stabilize your torso. Lower the bar back to shoulder height and repeat.

name: Cable Face Pull
description: Cable exercise for the rear deltoids and rotator cuff, performed with external rotation at the top.
instructions: Set a cable to head height with a rope attachment. Grip the rope with both hands using an overhand grip. Pull the rope toward your face while externally rotating your shoulders so your hands end up beside your ears with elbows high. Squeeze your rear delts, then return to the start.

name: Barbell Squat
description: The king of leg exercises, a fundamental compound movement for overall lower body development.
instructions: Set the barbell across your upper traps in a squat rack. Unrack the bar and step back with feet shoulder-width apart, toes slightly out. Brace your core and squat down by bending at the hips and knees until your thighs are at least parallel to the floor. Drive through your feet to stand back up.

name: Front Squat
description: Squat variation with the barbell in the front rack position, emphasizing the quadriceps.
instructions: Set the barbell in the front rack position on your anterior deltoids with elbows high and upper arms parallel to the floor. Unrack and step back with feet shoulder-width apart. Squat down keeping your torso upright and elbows high. Drive through your heels to stand back up.

name: Romanian Deadlift
description: Hip hinge movement that primarily targets the hamstrings and glutes with a focus on the eccentric stretch.
instructions: Stand holding a barbell at hip height with an overhand grip, feet hip-width apart. With a slight knee bend, hinge at your hips and push your butt back, lowering the bar along your legs. Go down until you feel a deep stretch in your hamstrings, then drive your hips forward to return to standing.

name: Barbell Lunges
description: Unilateral leg exercise performed with a barbell on the back, excellent for building leg strength and balance.
instructions: Place a barbell across your upper back and unrack it. Step forward with one leg and lower your body until both knees are bent at 90 degrees, with your rear knee hovering just above the floor. Push through your front heel to return to standing. Alternate legs or complete all reps on one side.

name: Leg Press
description: Machine-based compound leg exercise that allows heavy loading without spinal compression.
instructions: Sit on the leg press machine and place your feet shoulder-width apart on the platform. Release the safety catches and lower the platform by bending your knees toward your chest until they reach about 90 degrees. Press the platform back up by extending your legs without fully locking out your knees.

name: Leg Extension
description: Machine-based isolation exercise for the quadriceps.
instructions: Sit on the leg extension machine with the pad on your lower shins and your back against the seat. Extend your legs by contracting your quadriceps until your legs are straight. Squeeze at the top, then slowly lower the weight back to the starting position.

name: Leg Curl
description: Machine-based isolation exercise for the hamstrings.
instructions: Lie face down on the leg curl machine with the pad positioned just above your heels and your knees at the edge of the bench. Curl your legs up toward your glutes by contracting your hamstrings. Squeeze at the top, then slowly lower the weight back down.

name: Calf Raises
description: Isolation exercise for the calves, performed standing on an elevated surface for full range of motion.
instructions: Stand on a calf raise machine or an elevated surface with just the balls of your feet on the edge. Lower your heels below the platform to get a full stretch. Push up onto your toes as high as possible, squeezing your calves at the top. Lower back down with control.

name: Bulgarian Split Squat
description: Challenging unilateral leg exercise with the rear foot elevated, targeting quads and glutes.
instructions: Stand a couple feet in front of a bench holding dumbbells at your sides. Place the top of one foot on the bench behind you. Lower your body by bending your front knee until your thigh is parallel to the floor. Drive through your front heel to stand back up. Complete all reps then switch legs.

name: Hack Squat
description: Machine-based squat variation that emphasizes the quadriceps with back support.
instructions: Stand on the hack squat machine platform with your back against the pad and shoulders under the shoulder pads. Place your feet shoulder-width apart. Release the safety handles and lower your body by bending your knees to at least 90 degrees. Press through your feet to return to the starting position.

name: Goblet Squat
description: Beginner-friendly squat variation holding a dumbbell or kettlebell at chest level.
instructions: Hold a dumbbell or kettlebell close to your chest with both hands. Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, toes pointed slightly out. Squat down by pushing your hips back and bending your knees, keeping your torso upright and elbows between your knees. Drive through your heels to stand back up.

name: Sumo Deadlift
description: Wide-stance deadlift variation that places more emphasis on the inner thighs and glutes.
instructions: Stand with a wide stance and toes pointed outward, barbell over mid-foot. Grip the bar with hands inside your legs. Keep your chest up, hips low, and back flat. Drive through your heels and extend your hips and knees to stand up with the barbell. Lower the bar back to the floor with control.

name: Hip Thrust
description: Glute-dominant exercise performed by driving the hips upward against resistance while the upper back is supported.
instructions: Sit on the floor with your upper back against a bench and a barbell across your hips. Plant your feet flat on the floor at shoulder width. Drive through your heels to raise your hips until your body forms a straight line from knees to shoulders. Squeeze your glutes at the top, then lower with control.

name: Glute Bridge
description: Bodyweight or lightly weighted glute exercise performed lying on the floor.
instructions: Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor, hip-width apart. Drive through your heels and squeeze your glutes to lift your hips off the floor until your body forms a straight line from knees to shoulders. Hold briefly at the top, then lower back down.

name: Step-ups
description: Functional unilateral exercise stepping onto an elevated platform holding dumbbells.
instructions: Stand in front of a sturdy bench or box holding a dumbbell in each hand. Step one foot onto the platform and drive through that heel to step up, bringing your other foot to the top. Step back down with the trailing foot first. Complete all reps on one side or alternate legs.

name: Wall Sit
description: Isometric leg exercise holding a seated position against a wall for time.
instructions: Stand with your back flat against a wall. Slide down the wall until your thighs are parallel to the floor and your knees are at 90 degrees. Keep your back pressed against the wall and hold this position for the desired duration. Your shins should be vertical with feet flat on the floor.

name: Box Jump
description: Plyometric exercise involving an explosive jump onto a raised platform.
instructions: Stand facing a sturdy box or platform with feet shoulder-width apart. Swing your arms back and bend your knees to load the jump. Explode upward, swinging your arms forward, and land softly on top of the box with both feet. Stand up fully, then step back down carefully.

name: Sissy Squat
description: Advanced quad isolation exercise that involves leaning back while bending the knees forward.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart, holding onto a support for balance. Rise onto your toes and simultaneously lean your torso back while bending your knees, allowing them to travel forward. Lower until you feel an intense stretch in your quads. Push through your toes to return to the top.

name: Leg Press Calf Raise
description: Calf raise variation performed on the leg press machine for heavy loading.
instructions: Sit on the leg press machine and place just the balls of your feet on the lower portion of the platform. Extend your legs almost fully. Push the platform by extending your ankles (pointing toes), then slowly let the platform push your toes back toward you for a full stretch. Repeat.

name: Seated Calf Raise
description: Calf exercise performed seated that primarily targets the soleus muscle.
instructions: Sit on the seated calf raise machine with the pads on your lower thighs and the balls of your feet on the platform. Release the safety catch and lower your heels to get a full stretch. Push up by extending your ankles as high as possible, squeezing your calves at the top. Lower with control.

name: Nordic Hamstring Curl
description: Advanced bodyweight exercise that eccentrically loads the hamstrings, excellent for injury prevention.
instructions: Kneel on a pad with your feet anchored under a sturdy object or held by a partner. Keep your body straight from knees to head. Slowly lower yourself toward the ground by extending at the knees, resisting gravity with your hamstrings. Lower as far as you can under control, then push off the ground and curl back up.

name: Walking Lunges
description: Dynamic lunge variation performed while walking forward, challenging balance and leg endurance.
instructions: Hold a dumbbell in each hand at your sides. Step forward into a lunge, lowering until both knees are at about 90 degrees. Push off the front foot and step your back leg forward directly into the next lunge, continuing to walk forward. Keep your torso upright throughout.

name: Pistol Squat
description: Advanced single-leg squat requiring significant strength, balance, and mobility.
instructions: Stand on one foot with the other leg extended in front of you. Extend your arms forward for balance. Slowly squat down on the standing leg as deep as possible while keeping the other leg off the ground. Drive through your heel to stand back up. This requires excellent balance and mobility.

name: Barbell Curl
description: Classic bicep exercise using a barbell for bilateral loading.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart holding a barbell with an underhand grip at arm's length. Keeping your upper arms stationary, curl the barbell up toward your shoulders by contracting your biceps. Squeeze at the top, then lower the bar back down with control. Avoid swinging.

name: Close-Grip Bench Press
description: Bench press variation with a narrow grip that shifts emphasis to the triceps.
instructions: Lie on a flat bench and grip the barbell with hands about shoulder-width apart or slightly narrower. Unrack the bar and lower it to your lower chest, keeping your elbows tucked close to your sides. Press the bar back up to full lockout, focusing on the tricep contraction.

name: Dumbbell Curl
description: Bicep isolation exercise using dumbbells, allowing independent arm movement and supination.
instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms at your sides, palms facing forward. Curl both dumbbells up toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary. Squeeze your biceps at the top, then lower the dumbbells back down with control. You can alternate arms or curl both simultaneously.

name: Hammer Curl
description: Bicep curl variation with a neutral grip that targets the brachialis and brachioradialis.
instructions: Stand holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms at your sides, palms facing each other (neutral grip). Curl the dumbbells up toward your shoulders, keeping your palms facing each other throughout. Squeeze at the top, then lower with control.

name: Tricep Kickback
description: Dumbbell isolation exercise for the triceps performed in a bent-over position.
instructions: Hinge forward at the hips with a dumbbell in one hand. Pin your upper arm against your side with elbow bent at 90 degrees. Extend your arm straight back by contracting your tricep until your arm is fully straight. Squeeze at the top, then return to the bent position. Complete all reps then switch arms.

name: Overhead Tricep Extension
description: Tricep exercise performed by extending a dumbbell overhead, emphasizing the long head.
instructions: Stand or sit holding a dumbbell with both hands overhead, arms fully extended. Lower the dumbbell behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms close to your ears. Extend your arms back to the starting position by contracting your triceps. Keep your upper arms stationary throughout.

name: Cable Curl
description: Bicep curl performed on a cable machine providing constant tension throughout the range of motion.
instructions: Stand facing a low cable pulley with a straight bar or EZ-bar attachment. Grip the bar with an underhand grip and arms extended. Curl the bar up toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary. Squeeze your biceps at the top, then lower with control.

name: Tricep Pushdown
description: Cable exercise isolating the triceps by pushing a handle or rope downward.
instructions: Stand facing a high cable pulley with a straight bar or rope attachment. Grip the handle with palms facing down and elbows pinned to your sides. Push the handle down until your arms are fully extended. Squeeze your triceps at the bottom, then slowly return to the starting position.

name: Dips
description: Compound bodyweight exercise primarily targeting the triceps when performed upright.
instructions: Grip parallel bars and lift yourself with arms extended, body upright. Keep your torso as vertical as possible and elbows close to your body. Lower yourself by bending your elbows until your upper arms are roughly parallel to the floor. Press back up to full arm extension.

name: Preacher Curl
description: Bicep isolation exercise performed on a preacher bench that eliminates body momentum.
instructions: Sit at a preacher bench with your upper arms resting on the angled pad. Hold an EZ-bar or barbell with an underhand grip, arms fully extended. Curl the bar up toward your shoulders. Squeeze your biceps at the top, then slowly lower the bar back to full extension.

name: Concentration Curl
description: Seated bicep curl with the elbow braced against the inner thigh for strict isolation.
instructions: Sit on a bench with legs spread. Hold a dumbbell in one hand and brace the back of that upper arm against your inner thigh. With your arm fully extended, curl the dumbbell up toward your shoulder. Squeeze at the top, then lower slowly. Complete all reps then switch arms.

name: EZ-Bar Curl
description: Bicep curl using an EZ-bar that reduces wrist strain with its angled grip.
instructions: Stand holding an EZ-bar with an underhand grip on the angled portions, arms extended. Curl the bar up toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary and elbows at your sides. Squeeze your biceps at the top, then lower the bar back down with control.

name: Spider Curl
description: Bicep isolation exercise performed face down on an incline bench, eliminating all momentum.
instructions: Lie face down on an incline bench set to about 45 degrees with your arms hanging straight down holding dumbbells. Curl the dumbbells up toward your shoulders without moving your upper arms. Squeeze at the top, then lower with control. The incline prevents any cheating or momentum.

name: Incline Dumbbell Curl
description: Bicep curl performed on an incline bench that places the biceps in a stretched position.
instructions: Sit on an incline bench set to 45-60 degrees with a dumbbell in each hand, arms hanging straight down. Curl the dumbbells up toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary. The incline stretches the biceps at the bottom for a greater range of motion. Lower with control.

name: Skull Crushers
description: Lying tricep extension performed by lowering a barbell or EZ-bar toward the forehead.
instructions: Lie on a flat bench holding an EZ-bar or barbell with arms extended directly above your chest. Keeping your upper arms stationary, bend your elbows to lower the bar toward your forehead. Extend your arms back to the starting position by contracting your triceps. Keep your elbows pointing toward the ceiling.

name: French Press
description: Seated or standing overhead tricep extension using an EZ-bar or barbell, targeting the long head.
instructions: Sit or stand holding an EZ-bar or barbell overhead with arms fully extended. Lower the bar behind your head by bending your elbows, keeping your upper arms vertical and close to your ears. Extend your arms back to the starting position by squeezing your triceps.

name: Diamond Push-ups
description: Push-up variation with hands close together forming a diamond shape, heavily targeting the triceps.
instructions: Get into a push-up position with your hands close together directly under your chest, thumbs and index fingers touching to form a diamond shape. Lower your body until your chest nearly touches your hands, keeping elbows close to your body. Push back up to full arm extension.

name: Reverse Curl
description: Curl variation with an overhand grip that targets the brachioradialis and forearm extensors.
instructions: Stand holding a barbell with an overhand (pronated) grip at shoulder width, arms extended. Curl the bar up toward your shoulders, keeping your upper arms stationary. This targets the top of the forearm more than standard curls. Lower with control.

name: Wrist Curl
description: Forearm isolation exercise performed by curling the wrist while holding a barbell or dumbbell.
instructions: Sit on a bench and rest your forearms on your thighs or a flat surface with your wrists hanging over the edge, palms facing up, holding dumbbells. Let your wrists extend down, then curl the weight up by flexing your wrists. Squeeze at the top and lower with control.

name: Bayesian Cable Curl
description: Cable curl performed with the arm behind the body, maximizing the bicep stretch under load.
instructions: Stand facing away from a low cable pulley holding the handle in one hand. Step forward so your arm is extended behind you with tension on the cable. Curl the handle forward and up toward your shoulder, keeping your elbow stationary. Lower with control back to the stretched position. Complete all reps then switch arms.

name: Overhead Cable Tricep Extension
description: Cable tricep extension performed facing away from the machine, targeting the long head of the triceps.
instructions: Set a cable to the lowest position with a rope attachment. Face away from the machine, holding the rope behind your head with elbows bent. Step forward to create tension. Extend your arms forward and overhead by straightening your elbows. Squeeze the triceps, then return to the start position.

name: Plank
description: Isometric core exercise holding a push-up-like position to build core stability and endurance.
instructions: Get into a forearm plank position with elbows directly under your shoulders and your body forming a straight line from head to heels. Engage your core by pulling your belly button toward your spine. Hold this position for the desired duration without letting your hips sag or pike up.

name: Crunches
description: Basic abdominal exercise targeting the upper portion of the rectus abdominis.
instructions: Lie on your back with knees bent and feet flat on the floor. Place your hands behind your head or across your chest. Curl your upper body toward your knees by contracting your abs, lifting your shoulder blades off the floor. Lower back down with control without fully relaxing.

name: Russian Twists
description: Rotational core exercise targeting the obliques, performed seated with a twisting motion.
instructions: Sit on the floor with knees bent and feet slightly elevated. Lean back slightly to engage your core, keeping your back straight. Hold a weight or clasp your hands together. Rotate your torso to one side, touch the weight to the floor beside your hip, then rotate to the other side. That is one rep.

name: Leg Raises
description: Core exercise focusing on the lower abdominals by raising the legs while lying down.
instructions: Lie flat on your back with legs straight and hands under your glutes or at your sides for support. Keeping your legs straight, raise them toward the ceiling until they are perpendicular to the floor. Slowly lower them back down without letting them touch the floor. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor.

name: Cable Woodchoppers
description: Rotational core exercise using a cable machine that mimics a chopping motion.
instructions: Set a cable pulley to the highest position and attach a handle. Stand sideways to the machine and grip the handle with both hands. With arms extended, pull the handle diagonally down and across your body, rotating your torso. Control the return to the starting position. Complete all reps then switch sides.

name: Dead Bug
description: Anti-extension core exercise performed lying on the back, coordinating opposite arm and leg movements.
instructions: Lie on your back with arms extended toward the ceiling and knees bent at 90 degrees above your hips. Slowly extend your right arm overhead and left leg straight out, hovering just above the floor. Return to the starting position and repeat with the opposite arm and leg. Keep your lower back pressed into the floor throughout.

name: Bird Dog
description: Core stability exercise performed on hands and knees, extending opposite arm and leg simultaneously.
instructions: Start on your hands and knees with wrists under shoulders and knees under hips. Simultaneously extend your right arm forward and left leg back until both are parallel to the floor. Hold briefly, then return to the start. Repeat with the opposite arm and leg. Keep your core tight and avoid rotating your hips.

name: Mountain Climbers
description: Dynamic core exercise performed in a plank position, driving the knees toward the chest in alternation.
instructions: Start in a high plank position with hands under shoulders. Drive one knee toward your chest, then quickly switch legs, driving the other knee forward as the first returns. Continue alternating at a rapid pace while keeping your hips level and core engaged.

name: Bicycle Crunches
description: Dynamic crunch variation targeting the obliques with a pedaling motion.
instructions: Lie on your back with hands behind your head and legs raised with knees bent at 90 degrees. Simultaneously bring your right elbow toward your left knee while extending your right leg. Alternate sides in a pedaling motion. Keep your lower back pressed to the floor and avoid pulling on your neck.

name: Ab Wheel Rollout
description: Advanced core exercise using an ab wheel to roll forward and back, challenging anti-extension strength.
instructions: Kneel on the floor holding an ab wheel with both hands. Slowly roll the wheel forward, extending your body as far as you can while maintaining a tight core and flat back. Do not let your hips sag. Pull the wheel back toward your knees by contracting your abs. Start with partial range of motion and progress.

name: Hanging Leg Raise
description: Advanced core exercise performed hanging from a pull-up bar, raising the legs to target lower abs.
instructions: Hang from a pull-up bar with an overhand grip, arms fully extended. With legs straight (or knees bent for easier variation), raise your legs until they are parallel to the floor or higher. Lower them back down with control, avoiding swinging. Focus on using your abs rather than hip flexors.

name: Pallof Press
description: Anti-rotation core exercise using a cable or band to resist rotational forces.
instructions: Stand sideways to a cable machine with the pulley at chest height. Hold the handle at your chest with both hands. Press the handle straight out in front of you, resisting the cable's pull to rotate you. Hold with arms extended briefly, then bring the handle back to your chest. Complete all reps then switch sides.

name: Side Plank
description: Isometric core exercise performed on one side to target the obliques and lateral core stability.
instructions: Lie on your side and prop yourself up on your forearm with your elbow directly under your shoulder. Stack your feet and lift your hips off the ground so your body forms a straight line. Hold this position for the desired duration, keeping your core tight. Switch sides after completing the hold.

name: Dragon Flag
description: Advanced core exercise popularized by Bruce Lee, involving lowering and raising the entire body as a rigid plank from a bench.
instructions: Lie on a bench and grip the edge behind your head. Raise your entire body up so only your upper back and shoulders remain on the bench, body rigid and straight. Slowly lower your body as a plank toward the bench without touching it, then raise back up. Your entire body should move as one unit.

name: V-ups
description: Dynamic core exercise simultaneously raising both arms and legs to form a V shape.
instructions: Lie flat on your back with arms extended overhead and legs straight. Simultaneously raise your arms and legs, folding your body at the hips to touch your toes at the top. Lower both your upper and lower body back to the floor with control. Keep your core tight throughout.

name: Flutter Kicks
description: Core exercise performed lying down with small alternating leg kicks to challenge the lower abdominals.
instructions: Lie flat on your back with hands under your glutes for support. Lift both legs a few inches off the floor. Alternately kick each leg up and down in a small range of motion, as if flutter-kicking in water. Keep your core engaged and lower back pressed into the floor throughout.

name: Woodchop (Dumbbell)
description: Rotational core exercise using a dumbbell to simulate a chopping motion from high to low.
instructions: Stand with feet wider than shoulder-width holding a dumbbell with both hands. Start with the dumbbell above one shoulder. Rotate your torso and bring the dumbbell diagonally down across your body toward the opposite knee, bending slightly. Reverse the motion back to the start. Complete all reps then switch sides.

name: Decline Sit-ups
description: Sit-up variation performed on a decline bench for increased resistance on the abdominals.
instructions: Sit on a decline bench with your feet secured under the leg pads. Cross your arms over your chest or place them behind your head. Lower your upper body back toward the bench until you feel a stretch in your abs. Contract your abs to sit back up to the starting position.

name: Cable Crunch
description: Kneeling core exercise using a cable for weighted resistance during the crunch movement.
instructions: Kneel in front of a high cable pulley with a rope attachment. Hold the rope at the sides of your head with your hands near your ears. Crunch down by flexing your spine, bringing your elbows toward your knees. Focus on curling your torso, not just bending at the hips. Return to the upright kneeling position.

name: Running
description: Outdoor or treadmill running, a fundamental cardiovascular exercise.
instructions: Begin at a comfortable pace, landing with your midfoot or forefoot under your center of gravity. Maintain an upright posture with slight forward lean, arms swinging naturally at your sides. Breathe rhythmically and adjust pace based on your fitness level and goals.

name: Cycling
description: Stationary bike or outdoor cycling, an excellent low-impact cardiovascular exercise.
instructions: Adjust the seat height so your leg has a slight bend at the bottom of the pedal stroke. Maintain a steady cadence of 60-90 RPM. Keep your core engaged and upper body relaxed. Adjust resistance to match your target heart rate zone.

name: Walking
description: Brisk walking or power walking, a low-impact cardiovascular activity suitable for all fitness levels.
instructions: Walk at a brisk pace (3-4 mph) with purposeful strides. Swing your arms naturally and maintain good posture with your head up and shoulders back. For added intensity, increase speed, add an incline, or use light hand weights.

name: Swimming
description: Full-body cardiovascular exercise performed in water using various stroke techniques.
instructions: Choose a stroke (freestyle, backstroke, breaststroke, or butterfly). Maintain a streamlined body position in the water. Coordinate your breathing with your stroke rhythm. Swim continuous laps or use interval training with rest periods between sets.

name: Rowing
description: Full-body cardiovascular exercise performed on a rowing machine or in water.
instructions: Sit on the rowing machine with feet secured on the footplates. Grab the handle with an overhand grip. Drive with your legs first, then lean back slightly and pull the handle to your lower ribs. Reverse the motion: extend arms, hinge forward at hips, then bend knees. Maintain a steady rhythm.

name: Elliptical
description: Low-impact cardiovascular exercise performed on an elliptical machine.
instructions: Step onto the elliptical and grip the handles. Begin pedaling in a smooth, continuous motion. Keep your core engaged and maintain an upright posture. Adjust the resistance and incline to vary the intensity. You can pedal forward or backward to target different muscles.

name: Jump Rope
description: High-intensity cardiovascular exercise using a skipping rope.
instructions: Hold the rope handles at hip height with elbows close to your body. Swing the rope using your wrists, not your arms. Jump just high enough to clear the rope, landing softly on the balls of your feet. Keep your jumps small and maintain a steady rhythm. Start with basic jumps before progressing to double unders or crossovers.

name: Stair Climbing
description: Cardiovascular exercise using a stair machine or actual stairs.
instructions: On a stair machine, set your desired speed and step at a steady pace. Keep your posture upright and avoid leaning heavily on the handles. Drive through each step with your full foot. For actual stairs, walk or jog up at a consistent pace and use the descent as active recovery.

name: HIIT
description: High-intensity interval training alternating between maximum effort and recovery periods.
instructions: Choose your exercise modality (sprints, bike, bodyweight circuits, etc.). Perform maximum effort work for 20-40 seconds followed by a rest period of equal or longer duration. Repeat for 15-30 minutes total. Warm up thoroughly before starting and cool down afterward. Adjust work-to-rest ratios based on fitness level.

name: Boxing
description: Cardiovascular workout involving heavy bag work, shadow boxing, or boxing drills.
instructions: Assume a boxing stance with your lead foot forward and hands up protecting your face. Practice combinations of jabs, crosses, hooks, and uppercuts. Keep your core tight and rotate your hips into each punch. Work in rounds of 2-3 minutes with 30-60 seconds rest between rounds.

name: Battle Ropes
description: High-intensity conditioning exercise using heavy ropes for upper body and cardiovascular training.
instructions: Stand facing the anchor point with feet shoulder-width apart, holding one rope end in each hand. Bend your knees slightly and brace your core. Create alternating waves by rapidly raising and lowering each arm. You can also try simultaneous waves, slams, or circles. Work in timed intervals of 20-40 seconds.

name: Burpees
description: Full-body explosive exercise combining a squat, push-up, and jump in one continuous movement.
instructions: Stand with feet shoulder-width apart. Drop into a squat and place your hands on the floor. Jump your feet back into a plank position and perform a push-up. Jump your feet back toward your hands and explosively jump into the air with arms overhead. Land softly and immediately begin the next rep.

name: Mountain Biking
description: Outdoor cardiovascular activity riding a bicycle on off-road trails and terrain.
instructions: Wear proper safety gear including a helmet. Adjust your seat height for optimal pedaling efficiency. Shift gears to maintain a comfortable cadence on varied terrain. Keep your weight centered and use your arms and legs as suspension on rough trails. Look ahead to anticipate obstacles.

name: Kettlebell Swings
description: Dynamic hip-hinge exercise swinging a kettlebell between the legs and overhead, combining strength and cardio.
instructions: Stand with feet slightly wider than shoulder-width, holding a kettlebell with both hands. Hinge at your hips to swing the kettlebell between your legs, then explosively drive your hips forward to swing it up to chest or overhead height. Let the kettlebell swing back between your legs and repeat in a continuous rhythm.

name: Sled Push
description: Conditioning exercise pushing a weighted sled across a surface for total body cardiovascular training.
instructions: Load the sled with your desired weight. Grip the handles at chest height and lean into the sled at about a 45-degree angle. Drive through your legs with powerful strides, pushing the sled forward across the surface. Keep your core braced and maintain a low body position for maximum power.

name: Assault Bike
description: Air resistance bike that uses both arms and legs for a demanding full-body cardiovascular workout.
instructions: Sit on the assault bike and grip the handles. Begin pedaling while simultaneously pushing and pulling the handles. The resistance increases with your effort. Maintain an upright posture and steady breathing. Use for steady-state cardio or intense intervals.

name: Ski Erg
description: Cardiovascular machine simulating the double-pole motion of cross-country skiing.
instructions: Stand facing the ski erg machine. Reach up and grab the handles with both hands. Pull the handles down forcefully by hinging at the hips and engaging your lats and arms, driving them past your hips. Stand back up and reach overhead to repeat. Use a continuous, rhythmic motion for sustained cardio.

name: Incline Dumbbell Flyes
description: Chest isolation exercise performed on an incline bench, targeting the upper portion of the pectoralis major.
instructions: Set a bench to a 30-45 degree incline. Lie back holding a dumbbell in each hand with arms extended above your chest, palms facing each other. With a slight bend in your elbows, lower the dumbbells out to the sides in a wide arc until you feel a stretch in your upper chest. Squeeze your chest to bring them back together.

name: Dumbbell Pullover
description: Chest and lat exercise performed lying across a bench, pulling a dumbbell in an arc over the chest.
instructions: Lie perpendicular across a bench with your upper back supported and feet flat on the floor. Hold a dumbbell with both hands above your chest, arms slightly bent. Lower the dumbbell back behind your head in an arc until you feel a stretch in your chest and lats. Pull the dumbbell back over your chest.

name: Inverted Row
description: Bodyweight horizontal pulling exercise performed under a bar, an excellent progression toward pull-ups.
instructions: Set a barbell in a rack at about waist height. Hang underneath the bar with an overhand grip, body straight and heels on the floor. Pull your chest up to the bar by squeezing your shoulder blades together. Lower yourself back down with control. Adjust difficulty by changing your body angle.

name: Reverse Grip Lat Pulldown
description: Lat pulldown variation using an underhand grip to increase bicep involvement and target the lower lats.
instructions: Sit at the lat pulldown machine and grip the bar with an underhand (supinated) grip at shoulder width. Pull the bar down toward your upper chest, focusing on driving your elbows down and back. Squeeze your lats at the bottom, then slowly return the bar to the top with arms fully extended.

name: Landmine Press (Shoulders)
description: Single-arm overhead pressing variation using a landmine setup, easier on the shoulders than traditional overhead presses.
instructions: Stand facing a landmine barbell and grip the end with one hand at shoulder height. Press the barbell up and away from you until your arm is fully extended. The angled path is easier on the shoulder joint than vertical pressing. Lower with control and repeat. Switch arms after completing your set.

name: Sumo Squat
description: Wide-stance squat variation that emphasizes the inner thighs and glutes.
instructions: Stand with a wide stance, toes pointed outward at 45 degrees, holding a dumbbell with both hands hanging between your legs. Squat down by bending your knees outward over your toes until your thighs are parallel to the floor. Drive through your heels to return to standing.

name: Bench Dips
description: Bodyweight tricep exercise using a bench for support, suitable for beginners.
instructions: Sit on the edge of a bench with your hands gripping the edge beside your hips. Slide your butt off the bench with legs extended or bent. Lower your body by bending your elbows until your upper arms are parallel to the floor. Press back up to full arm extension.
